The poor could mock the rich, the humble could deride the powerful. A “fool’s pope” was elected and one could disguised himself as a bull, a cow, a deer or other pagan divinities. In New Orleans, the carnival has preserved this sense of liberty. Suddenly, everything is permitted, even the most absurd extravagance.

title: A Filmic Relationship
overview: Screened at the Ann Arbor Film Festival

title: Hunt Saboteurs
overview: Cameras follow shock troops of anti-hunt demonstrators disrupting hunt.

title: John Huston and the Dubliners
overview: John Huston and the Dubliners is a valentine to the late director and a relatively standard production film about his making of The Dead. Much time is devoted to the actors' understandably admiring comments about Mr. Huston, and to the disposition of the prop department's fake snow. The film has the potential to seem ordinary, but it becomes touched with magic whenever the director makes his presence felt. Mr. Huston displays his characteristic gallantry and his keen attention to seemingly unimportant touches ("Don't worry about what you say, just keep talking," he tells one actor, and gives precise instructions for reading the line "Would you please pass the celery?"). He describes The Dead as "lacework," and this film makes the aptness of that description very clear.

title: After the Break
overview: Personalities clash in a lesbian therapy group.

title: You Don’t Die Here
overview: Jon Else’s open-ended documentary showing Death Valley, Calif., as a cruel and sublime backdrop against which a small group of aging residents reminisce about a past that seems like a distant, half-remembered dream.

title: Three States of the Electronics
overview: " A synthesis film about the electrical means of command and control, which prove the modern orientation of the Romanian industry: neurons within integrated circuits drive industrial machinery, excavators, robots, turbines, entire assembly lines. "

title: Epic Theater & Post-heroic Management
overview: The discussion begins with the parable of a frog in boiling water. It comes from the book "Post-heroic Management: A Manual" by Dirk Baecker, which is what Heiner Müller is currently reading at the time of the discussion.

title: The Takanosu-machi Thereafter
overview: Mayor Iwakawa was voted into office in 1991, promising better welfare for senior citizens. As a result of his efforts to create a town with resident participation, while battling against anti-reform forces of the town council, Takanosu-machi becomes the best welfare town in Japan. In the nationwide local elections in 2003, however, Iwakawa, loses by a huge margin against the opposing candidate who promises the consolidation of local municipalities.

title: The Hapless Antiquarian
overview: An antiquarian acquires a rare, cursed book and then  finds that he cannot get rid of it.

title: プライベート映像
overview: Documentary style short film following three Japanese performance artists at a festival.

title: You Only Live Twice
overview: A new craze has hit cyberspace. They're called virtual worlds and are 3D computer generated universes where you sign up, choose a body, build a house and you're ready to live out your Second Life. In online virtual worlds, like Second Life, everyone is beautiful or exotic. You can chat up strangers, slay mythical dragons or create your fantasy business and even make real money. Some claim Second Life will be more influential than eBay or MySpace. 'You Only Live Twice' takes a fascinating, sometimes humorous, look at the heavily marketed promises and potential pitfalls of virtual worlds.

title: Mabou Mines Dollhouse
overview: In this film, the director deconstructs the oft-staged Ibsen classic A Dollhouse.

title: Opowieść
overview: A young man starts a new life in a small town near Łódź.

title: Shore of Love
overview: Nawal is involved in a boating accident near an island at sea. She wakes up to find herself in the care of two brothers, Ghassan and Adel. They soon discover that she has lost her memory, and both of them fall in love with her, each trying to get closer to her. Nawal eventually falls for Ghassan. When Adel consults a doctor to understand her condition, the doctor informs him that if she regains her memory, she will no longer recognize either of them. Despite this, Adel continues to search for clues about her past and eventually discovers that she has a sister in Egypt who closely resembles her.

title: Cold Cows
overview: What ice storm? All this cows can think about are their past lives.

title: Animation for Fallen Catholics
overview: 1 Opening dance  2 THE DIVINE MIRACLE  3 REGINA COELI.  4 SIMPLY DIVINE  5 LANDSCAPE WITH THE FALL OF ICARUS  6 Intermission song  7 ALTERATIONS  8 HEAVENLY TASTE  9 DIVINE DEPARTURE  10 Finale dance

title: Powergame
overview: Powergame is an exciting and unique behind the scenes look at the career of Jonathon Power, the first Canadian and first North American to win the World Squash Championship.The documentary tracks Power’s historic year as he battles the world’s top players (including Canada’s other world-ranked squash player, Graham Ryding) for the ultimate title in Squash.

title: L’Eye
overview: If at first you don’t succeed, scry, scry again. 16mm film.

title: A Szépség és a Szörnyeteg - musical
Jim the Man
overview: JIM THE MAN is a new kind of American film with violent montage effects, starkly beautiful photography and a unique story construction that ends in a startling eruption of psychological images. It tells the story of Jim Curtiss, a man now detached from reality. His fantasies and realities are out of connection; he struggles to join his dreamlife with his realife; he goes through a series of adventures which underline his isolation. He is an emblem of the lonely bachelor threading his way though the city. –M. K.

title: Echo
overview: Dan, where ya at?

title: Black Harmony, Hi-Fi
overview: A portrait of a place in the context of being an outsider; a personal travelogue working to concentrate the perceived qualities of life, light, and the spirit of the island. The textural dynamics of sound and image were strongly considered in the editing process to crystallize my observation and experience while there.

title: Cambridge
overview: Shown at the Ann Arbor Film Festival

title: Acid From Heaven
overview: Many years ago there was a popular song suggesting that each time it rained it rained pennies from heaven. Today's reality is that when it rains, it rains acid from heaven. By re-enacting a case study of a person whose income was cut off as a direct result of acid rain, this presentation provides, in laymen's terms, some basic information about this little-known form of pollution.

title: Поездка к сыну
overview: A widow is expecting a child.

title: Primal Scream: Live at The London Astoria
overview: From 2000, Primal Scream touring in support of  XTRMNTR on the UK LIve programme.

title: A Hard Straight
overview: A gang member, a hustler, and a small-time dealer discover that walking out of the prison gates is just the beginning of the journey to go straight.
